citation.article-title: Rhizobium alkalisoli sp. nov., isolated from Caragana intermedia growing in saline-alkaline soils in the north of China
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Rhizobium alkalisoli sp. nov.

Rhizobium alkalisoli [al.ka.li.so′li. N.L. n. alkali (from Arabic al-qaliy), alkali; L. n. solum soil; N.L. gen. n. alkalisoli of alkaline soil, referring to the fact that the bacterium was isolated from Caragana intermedia grown in saline-alkali soil].
Cells are Gram-negative, aerobic, motile, non-spore-forming rods, 0.3–0.5 μm wide and 1–3 μm long.
Colonies on YMA medium are circular, convex, white and opaque, with a diameter of 1–2 mm within 2–3 days at 28 °C.
Growth occurs on YMA agar in 0–3 % NaCl (optimum, 1 %).
Growth occurs at 12–37 °C and pH 5–10 on YMA, with optimum growth at 28 °C and pH 7.0.
Catalase, urease and oxidase are present, but not l-phenylalaninase.
Nitrate is not reduced and reduction of methyl blue is not observed.
Lactic acid production, reduction of litmus and acid curd formation are produced in litmus milk tests.
Does not hydrolyse gelatin, casein, starch, DNA or Tween 80.
Indole is produced, but not H2S, and the Voges–Proskauer and methyl red reaction are negative.
Resistant to (μg ml−1): ampicillin (300), kanamycin sulfate (50), neomycin sulfate (5), streptomycin sulfate (5), bacitracin (300), erythromycin (50) and chloramphenicol (5).
Growth occurs on YMA with Bismarck brown (0.1 %), congo red (0.1 %), erythrosin B (0.1 %), neutral red (0.1 %) and sodium deoxycholate (0.1 %).

Utilizes d-arabinose, d-fructose, d-galactose, d-mannose, melezitose, d-ribose, d-sorbitol, dl-malate, glucose, inositol, l-methionine, l-rhamnose, l-proline, meso-erythritol, raffinose, salicin, sodium citrate, d-sodium gluconate, sodium maltose, sodium pyruvate, sodium succinate, sucrose and trehalose as sole carbon sources, and (+)-l-aspartic acid, (+)-l-glutamic acid, d-glutamic acid, dl-alanine, d-threonine, glycine, hypoxanthine, l-arginine, l-cystine, l-hydroxyproline, l-isoleucine, l-lysine, l-phenylalanine, l-threonine and l-valine as sole nitrogen sources.

Does not utilize adipic acid, vanillic acid, calcium gluconate, calcium malonate, d-amygdalin, melibiose, d-xylose, dextrin, dl-asparagine, dulcitol, glycine, inulin, l-arginine, l-threonine, sodium acetate, sodium formate, sodium tartrate, soluble starch, sorbose or syringic acid as sole carbon sources.
The G+C content of the type strain is 65.47 mol% (Tm).
The type strain, CCBAU 01393T (=LMG 24763T=HAMBI 3051T), was isolated from nodules of Caragana intermedia grown in saline-alkaline soils in Qingshuihe city, Inner Mongolia, China.
